transportAdvice: Tromsø's compact city centre is walkable, though icy winter conditions require caution on foot. A reliable public bus network connects the city centre, university, and surrounding areas, and taxis are readily available for longer journeys or late-night travel.

weather.description: Deep polar night with no sun above the horizon; cold, snowy conditions and frequent northern lights opportunities.
Still firmly winter with heavy snow and darkness, but the first hints of returning twilight appear around midday.
The sun returns above the horizon and days lengthen rapidly, though snow and cold temperatures persist.
Spring begins to take hold with longer days and milder temperatures, though snow showers are still common.
The midnight sun season approaches, bringing extended daylight and noticeably warmer, more pleasant conditions.
Full midnight sun with the sun not setting at all; mild and relatively bright around the clock.
The warmest month of the year with continuous daylight, green landscapes, and the best conditions for outdoor activities.
Still warm and bright with long days, though the midnight sun ends and darkness begins to return gradually.
Autumn arrives with cooling temperatures, increasing rain, and the first chances to see the northern lights again.
Noticeably colder and wetter with frequent storms; northern lights viewing improves as nights lengthen significantly.
Polar night begins in late November, bringing near-total darkness and cold, snowy conditions.
Full polar night with no sunrise; cold and snowy, but excellent conditions for northern lights and winter atmosphere.
